channel.title: Resources on MobliMic.com
channel.description: Recent content in Resources on MobliMic.com

item.title: "Weekly" Resource #3
item.description: These “weekly” resource posts are getting fewer and far between each time I write one. So from now on, I will be changing them by removing the weekly part and instead just make them whenever I think I have found enough content to put in them. Some weeks I come across loads of things that I think are cool, interesting, or useful and others nothing at all. git pro tip First up a blog post that has helped me a couple of times where I haven’t branched before making a commit.

item.title: Weekly Resource #2
item.description: This resource post is very late and very thin on the ground this week! I was at a conference over the weekend so here’s a link to the youtube playlist of the videos. There will be some content worth watching in there! I’d recommend watching the talk on Empathy-Driven Development when it gets uploaded. JSConfEU 2018 YouTube playlist Also here are some links Testing for non-testers WCAG 2.1 was published this week You can find all the weekly resource posts here

item.title: Weekly Resource #1
item.description: Here begins my first weekly resource post! I’ll try to keep doing these regularly but who knows how long I’ll keep them up! This week will be a dump of stuff I’ve found from the past few weeks. I’ve listed a few books I’ve read/am reading and some language learning resources etc. Articles I liked and thought were worth a read Spend 5 hours a week learning You don’t understand your software engineers Why should you learn Go?
